Module nbbrd.picocsv
Package nbbrd.picocsv

Class Csv.Reader

java.lang.Object
nbbrd.picocsv.Csv.Reader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, CharSequence, Csv.LineReader
Enclosing class:
Csv
public static final class Csv.Reader extends Object implements Csv.LineReader, Closeable
CSV reader. Reads CSV from a character-input stream, buffering characters in order to provide efficient reading.

This class is created by a static factory method. 

 try (java.io.Reader chars = ...; Csv.Reader csv = Csv.Reader.of(Csv.Format.DEFAULT, Csv.ReaderOptions.DEFAULT, chars)) {
   ...
 }
While chaining streams on creation is possible, it is recommended to use the "try-with-resources with multiple resources" pattern instead. This ensures that the resources are properly closed on a class initialization failure.

The buffer size can be specified. Ideally, it should align with the underlying input but the Csv.DEFAULT_CHAR_BUFFER_SIZE should be ok for most usage.
Note that the CSV reader maintains its own buffer so there is no need to create a BufferedReader.

See Also:
